fantasticlib.error.notEnoughItemFilterAr: Not enough arguments for item filter: %s
fantasticlib.error.tooManyItemFilterArgs: Too many arguments for item filter: %s
fantasticlib.error.itemForFilterNotFound: Item for item filter not found: %s
fantasticlib.error.tooManyNBTValues: Each NBT tag can only be set to one value!  Error in item filter: %s
fantasticlib.error.notEnoughPotionArgs: Not enough arguments for potion effect (should be min of 1): %s
fantasticlib.error.tooManyPotionArgs: Too many arguments for potion effect (should be max of 3): %s
fantasticlib.error.potionAmpNotNumber: Amplifier for potion is not a number: %s
fantasticlib.error.potionDurNotNumber: Duration for potion is not a number: %s
fantasticlib.error.potionIntrvNotNumber: Interval for potion is not a number: %s
fantasticlib.config.entityRenderFixer.to:
FILLSCREEN If enabled, runs some code to reset certain openGL settings after each entity renders

Only use this if you need it to fix a graphical issue
fantasticlib.config.inventoryDesyncFixer: FILLSCREEN If enabled, runs some code to synchronize inventory to client when it changes server-side\n \n
fantasticlib.config.previewRenderModeOve:
FILLSCREEN Overrides for render modes when previewing AW skins on items
Syntax is...
Slotting, Channel@Mode, Channel@Mode, etc
Valid entries for 'Slotting' can be found in config/fantasticlib/reference/slottings.txt
Valid channels and modes depend on the AW skins on the server (ask server admin)
Eg. if Tiamat Inventory is installed and a server has valid shoulder skins for it...
Tiamat Shoulders, ShoulderL@On, ShoulderR@On, ShoulderLControl@On, ShoulderRControl@On
fantasticlib.config.negativeAttributes.t: FILLSCREEN A list of attributes which are bad to have, for render color purposes\n \n
fantasticlib.config.tooltipScaling.toolt: FILLSCREEN Multiplies tooltip render size by this amount\n \n
fantasticlib.config.zoomFocusMouse: Focus Zoom on Mouse by Default
fantasticlib.config.zoomFocusMouse.toolt:
FILLSCREEN Whether zooming in/out focuses on the mouse position or not in a zoomable GUI view (if not, center of view is used instead)
Whichever mode is *NOT* the default can be accessed by holding the ctrl key while using zoom controls
fantasticlib.config.zoomResetButton.tool: FILLSCREEN Which mouse button resets the zoom level in a zoomable GUI view (click)\n \n
fantasticlib.config.panButton.tooltip: FILLSCREEN Which mouse button pans the view in a pannable GUI view (hold and drag)\n \n
fantasticlib.config.zoomRate.tooltip: FILLSCREEN How fast zoomable views zoom\n \n
fantasticlib.config.perGUIScaling.toolti:
FILLSCREEN The scaling for each applicable GUI
Applicable GUIs should show up here automatically if they've been accessed at least once
fantasticlib.config.rayMaterialFilter.to:
FILLSCREEN Syntax is...
material, transparent

Eg...
air, true

Vanilla types:
air, grass, ground, wood, rock, iron, anvil, water, lava, leaves, plants, vine, sponge, cloth, fire, sand, circuits, carpet, glass, redstone_light, tnt, coral, ice, packed_ice, snow, crafted_snow, cactus, clay, gourd, dragon_egg, portal, cake, web, piston, barrier, structure_void
